channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog mess by food stall, 21st December
item.description:
Large amount of trampled dog mess spread on pavement by food stalls in Christmas market about to open.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Chatsworth Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Dead fox on road / verge, 21st December
item.description:
There id no pavement so people have to walk on the grass verge to avoid cars there is a dead fox on the grass /road area between lower gate of No 38 king johns walk and the garages As lots of families use this especially on Sunday it is not exactly what you would want children to come across found this morning on my dog walk so must have been killed overnight
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Court Yard, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tiny bin attached to lampost is totally inadequate, 21st December
item.description:
Bin is too small for the amount of litter generated by shops opposite and attracts fly-tipping of household waste. Currently there is a bin bag and small roll of carpet standing against lampost. Consideration should be given to providing a large (and fox proof) bin on the pavement outside shops and that enforcement action is taken against shop storing waste cardboard which is not only unsightly but gets blown around.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crown Lane, Southborough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Boycott Israeli Apartheid stickers along street, 21st December
item.description:
Anti Israel stickers stuck on every single lamppost along Lordship Park until the junction with Queen Elizabeth Drive. Creates atmosphere of intimidation/division in this area. Appeared last week. Unpleasant for this community. Can they be removed?
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lordship Park, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
